Step 1: Update System
    sudo apt update
    sudo apt full-upgrade

Step 2: Install Packages
    sudo apt install sway waybar wofi swaylock swayidle swaybg mako grim slurp wl-clipboard \
    brightnessctl foot network-manager pipewire wireplumber pipewire-pulse \
    greetd tuigreet fonts-font-awesome fonts-noto-color-emoji \
    xdg-desktop-portal xdg-desktop-portal-gtk xdg-desktop-portal-wlr polkit-1

Step 3: Enable System Services
    sudo systemctl enable NetworkManager
    sudo systemctl enable greetd

Step 4: Allow Brightness Control Without Root
    sudo usermod -aG video $USER

Step 5: Configure greetd (with tuigreet)
    sudo mkdir -p /etc/greetd
    sudo tee /etc/greetd/config.toml > /dev/null <<EOF
    [terminal]
    vt = 1

    [default_session]
    command = "tuigreet --time --remember --asterisks --cmd sway"
    EOF

Step 6: Reboot to greetd Login
    sudo reboot
On boot, tuigreet (text-based) will appear.
Log in with your username/password.
Sway will start automatically.

Step 7: First Sway Launch – Generate Base Config
On first start, Sway prompts for keybindings (vim/emacs arrows) and generates ~/.config/sway/config.
Choose your preference (default is fine).

Step 8: Configure Sway (~/.config/sway/config)
Edit the file (e.g., nano ~/.config/sway/config) and 
add/replace these lines (append at end if not present; comment out any existing bar {} block to disable built-in swaybar):
    # Start recommended utilities
    exec mako                  # notifications
    exec swaybg -c "#000000"   # solid black background (replace with -i /path/to/wallpaper.jpg if desired)
    exec swayidle -w timeout 300 'swaylock -f' \
                    timeout 600 'swaymsg "output * dpms off"' \
                    resume 'swaymsg "output * dpms on"'

    # App launcher
    bindsym $mod+d exec wofi --show drun --allow-images

    # Lock screen
    bindsym $mod+l exec swaylock -f

    # Input (default works, add if needed for layout)
    input * xkb_layout us   # change to your layout if needed
Save and reload Sway: $mod+Shift+c (reload config) or logout/relogin.

Step 9: Configure Waybar
Create directories and files:
    mkdir -p ~/.config/waybar
~/.config/waybar/config.jsonc (functional modules as requested):
    {
        "layer": "top",
        "position": "top",
        "height": 36,
        "modules-left": ["sway/workspaces", "sway/mode"],
        "modules-center": ["clock"],
        "modules-right": ["network", "pulseaudio", "backlight", "battery", "tray"],

        "sway/workspaces": {
            "disable-scroll": true,
            "all-outputs": true
        },
        "clock": {
            "format": "{:%H:%M %a %d/%m}",
            "tooltip-format": "{:%A, %d %B %Y}"
        },
        "network": {
            "format-wifi": "{essid} ",
            "format-ethernet": "",
            "format-disconnected": "Disconnected ⚠",
            "tooltip-format": "{ifname}: {ipaddr}/{cidr}"
        },
        "pulseaudio": {
            "format": "{volume}% {icon}",
            "format-muted": "Muted ",
            "format-icons": ["", "", ""]
        },
        "backlight": {
            "format": "{percent}% "
        },
        "battery": {
            "format": "{capacity}% {icon}",
            "format-icons": ["", "", "", "", ""],
            "format-charging": "{capacity}% "
        },
        "tray": {
            "spacing": 10
        }
    }
~/.config/waybar/style.css (dark theme + hover-reveal: bar hides off-screen, reveals on mouse hover over top edge; 4px trigger strip visible):
    * {
        font-family: Noto Sans, Font Awesome 6 Free;
        font-size: 14px;
        padding: 0 8px;
    }

    #waybar {
        background: rgba(30, 30, 46, 0.95);
        color: #ffffff;
        margin-top: -32px;               /* hides most of bar */
        transition: margin-top 0.3s ease;
        border-radius: 0 0 10px 10px;
    }

    #waybar:hover {
        margin-top: 0;                  /* reveals on hover */
    }

    #workspaces button {
        padding: 0 10px;
        color: #ffffff;
    }

    #workspaces button.focused {
        background: #64727D;
        border-radius: 10px;
    }

    #clock, #network, #pulseaudio, #backlight, #battery, #tray {
        padding: 0 15px;
    }

Step 10: Start Waybar
Add to ~/.config/sway/config (if not already):
    exec waybar

Reload Sway ($mod+Shift+c) or relogin.

The bar appears at top, hidden except for a thin 4px trigger at the very top edge.
Hover mouse at top edge → bar slides down (visible).
Move mouse away → hides again.
Icons are functional: click volume/brightness/network/battery to adjust (via controls or menus).


Final Notes

Test: Open terminal ($mod+Return → foot), launch apps ($mod+d → wofi), lock ($mod+l), idle lock after 5 min.
GUI apps: Install e.g. sudo apt install firefox-esr – runs fine.
Audio/WiFi: Works via Pipewire/NetworkManager (connect via nmtui if needed initially).
Screenshots: grim -g "$(slurp)" /path/to/file.png.
If issues: Check logs (journalctl -b -u greetd or swaymsg -t get_version).
This matches Sway-recommended tools and Debian packaging.

Logout/relogin or reboot to apply everything. Setup complete.
